title: Pregnant WAG Jesinta Franklin shows off her burgeoning baby bump
text:
She regularly posts updates of her pregnancy journey to social media.

And on Thursday, Jesinta Franklin (née Campbell) gave fans another glimpse of her journey into motherhood by sharing a snap of her ever-growing baby bump.

Taking to Instagram, the 28-year-old model uploaded the artistic shot, which showed her standing side on and proudly flaunting her belly in front of the ocean.

Bumping along! Jesinta Franklin gave fans a glimpse of her journey into motherhood on Thursday when she shared this artistic photo of herself flaunting her baby bump in a swimsuit

Gently cradling her belly with both hands, Jesinta tilts her head upwards as she soaks up the sun's rays with her eyes closed.

Sporting a chic white one-piece swimsuit, she wears her blonde tresses slicked back off her face, revealing a pair of golden hooped earrings.

Fans were quick to comment on the post, with one person writing: 'Omg, gorgeous photo, can’t wait to see bubba when born.'

Speaking honestly: In a recent interview, the model revealed it took her and husband Lance 'Buddy' Franklin (left) 'years' to conceive

Wish you were here? While Jesinta didn't reveal where she was staying, several of her Instagram followers speculated that she was at the Thirty-One Degrees hotel in Port Douglas

Another person commented: 'Beautiful woman you will make the most loving vibrant mama! This baby is blessed beyond measure already.'

A third fan added: 'Beautiful shot, beautiful bump.'

While Jesinta didn't reveal where she was staying, several followers speculated from the photo that she was at the Thirty-One Degrees hotel in Oak Beach, Port Douglas.

Beautiful: Jesinta previously flaunted her burgeoning baby bump in this artistic shot

According to the website, the hotel's villas range from $1,100 to $2,000 a night.

Jesinta's most recent post comes after she spoke out about her struggles to fall pregnant, and how the experience had strengthened her marriage to Buddy Franklin.

'It's not something that's openly talked about, there's a big stigma around it, so if I can share my journey, then hopefully I can give someone else hope,' she said, adding that it took the couple 'years' to conceive.
description: She regularly posts updates of her pregnancy journey to social media.
authors: Mark Brook For Daily Mail Australia
